Hi, I'm Saurav !

I am currently pursuing Masters in Robotics specialization at University of Maryland, college Park. My research interests are in the field of path planning, perception and implementing ML and RL algorithms for autonomous maneuvers.

Prior to university of Maryland, I worked at Honda R&D India, where I evaluated and validated Honda two-wheeler engines.

Before Honda R&D India, I was Manager in R&D Prototype and testing team at Daimler India. During my tenure at Daimler, I was responsible for the development of design test plan, validation and, functional evaluation of power-train system for the prototype vehicles including Bharatbenz, Fuso and Mercedes Benz Trucks.

While working in automobile R&D industry, I developed interest in the autonomous vehicles and decided to pursue my passion in that field.

Currently, I keep myself busy in developing skill sets required for autonomous systems.

Nearly all of my code is open source, and I enjoy contributing to other open source projects.

I primarily code in c++ and Python, but dabble in other languages.

Other interesting tidbits:

  • I completed my Bachelors from National Institute of Technology, Silchar in Mechanical Engineering in year 2013.
  • I'm a decent table tennis player, an enthusiastic traveler, and a decent home cook.

Projects & Activities

A* Algorithm with Diffrential constraint

A* Algorithm is path search algorithm which is used to find the optimal path between start and goal node using a given heuristic. In this project, we had to implement A* algorithm with diffrentail constraint, followed by simulation of a turtlebot in the gazebo world.

Dijikstra algorithm

Dijikstra algorithm is also path search algorithm which arbitrarly explores the map without any heuristic and find the shortest path between start and goal end point.

Lane Detection

In this project,We had to apply a distortion correction to raw images,followed by image manupulation to create a thresholded binary image. Then, Apply a perspective transform to rectify binary image ("birds-eye view") and detect lane pixels and fit to find the lane boundary. Once the lane is detected, We had to determine the curvature of the lane and vehicle position with respect to center, Warp the detected lane boundaries back onto the original image.

Lucas Kanade Templaet Tracker

Lucas Kanade template tracker algorithmis a differential method for optical flow estimation. It assumes that the flow is essentially constant in a local neighbourhood of the pixel under consideration, and solves the basic optical flow equations for all the pixels in that neighbourhood, by the least squares criterion

Mountain Car problem

MountainCarproblem on a one-dimensional track, positioned between two "mountains". The goal is to drive up the mountain on the right; however, the car's engine is not strong enough to scale the mountain in a single pass. Therefore, the only way to succeed is to drive back and forth to build up momentum.

Behaviour Cloning

The objective of this project is to train a neural network, using data collected in simulator provided by Udacity to drive car autonomously.
